page.title: 20THE CHURCHES
page.content: The villages of Windrush and Sherborne share the school,shop and Post Office, all situated in Sherborne,but each has retained its church.Sherborne,pop 350, has suffered much from the personal tastes and alterations of more than one generation of the Dutton family, who met the costs themselves.Now they no longer own the estate,it is in serious structural condition,both inside and out,and estimates of up to Â£85,000 have been submitted.Promises to meet much of this have been made by Americans who own flats in Sherborne House.Attendance at Sunday worship is small.Windrush is a smaller community of 120,including weekend visitors,who take a lively interest in the Church and its activities,and the result is a well supported church,both in worship and finance,and in good order structually. Colin McCarter,Vicar.
